main event: An unidentified technician reported observing a pulsating light for approximately 5-6 seconds while preparing a camera station for a missile shoot on 25 Jan 1954.
interesting points: The object was reported to be a pulsating light observed through four complete cycles,The period of pulsation was approximately 1.5 seconds,The technician had five years of experience in astronomy and was certain that the object was not a meteor,The object exhibited an erratic motion of 30° to 135° per second,The conclusion suggests the object could possibly be a balloon, aircraft, or astronomical phenomenon but couldn't be definitively identified.
witness description: a technician with experience in astronomical observations
